DataElement.preferredName: Radioactive Instillation Therapy Administered Total Dose
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Implantation of radioactive material in an internal anatomic site._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test)._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Implantation of radioactive material in an internal anatomic site.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Implantation of radioactive material in an internal anatomic site.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
